content.raw:
While I agree that osrf/gazebo is wrong to not consider joint constraints when setting angular velocity, I think the example @azeey posted is slightly different because the model has two free boxes. You can see in the bottom animation that calling SetAngularVelocity gives a large linear velocity to one of the boxes, causing them to fly apart, which seems more wrong to me that the top animation.

I think setting the angular velocity of each FreeJoint without also setting linear velocity would still honor kinematic constraints but wouldn't cause models to fly apart.
